objenome.solver.evolve.mutate

Class SubtreeCrossover

  • java.lang.Object
    • objenome.solver.evolve.AbstractOrganismOperator
      • objenome.solver.evolve.mutate.SubtreeCrossover
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Listener<ConfigEvent>, GPContainer.GPContainerAware, OrganismOperator

    public class SubtreeCrossover
extends AbstractOrganismOperator
implements Listener<ConfigEvent>
    A crossover operator for STGPIndividuals that exchanges subtrees in two individuals. A bias can optionally be set to influence the probability that a terminal or a non-terminal is selected as the crossover points.

    See the #setup() method documentation for a list of configuration parameters used to control this operator.

    Since:
    2.0
    See Also:
    KozaCrossover, OnePointCrossover

      • SubtreeCrossover

        public SubtreeCrossover()
        Constructs a SubtreeCrossover with control parameters automatically loaded from the config

      • SubtreeCrossover

        public SubtreeCrossover(boolean autoConfig)
        Constructs a SubtreeCrossover with control parameters initially loaded from the config. If the autoConfig argument is set to true then the configuration will be automatically updated when the config is modified.
        Parameters:
        autoConfig - whether this operator should automatically update its configuration settings from the config

    • Method Detail

      • setConfig

        public void setConfig(GPContainer config)
        Sets up this operator with the appropriate configuration settings. This method is called whenever a ConfigEvent occurs for a change in any of the following configuration parameters:
        • RandomSequence.RANDOM_SEQUENCE
        • TERMINAL_PROBABILITY (default: -1.0)
        • PROBABILITY
        • TypedOrganism.MAXIMUM_DEPTH
        Specified by:
        setConfig in interface GPContainer.GPContainerAware
        Overrides:
        setConfig in class AbstractOrganismOperator

      • onEvent

        public void onEvent(ConfigEvent event)
        Receives configuration events and triggers this operator to configure its parameters if the ConfigEvent is for one of its required parameters.
        Specified by:
        onEvent in interface Listener<ConfigEvent>
        Parameters:
        event - the fired event object.

      • perform

        public TypedOrganism[] perform(OperatorEvent.EndOperator event,
                               Organism... parents)
        Performs a subtree crossover on the given individuals. A crossover point is randomly chosen in both programs and the subtrees at these points are exchanged.
        Overrides:
        perform in class AbstractOrganismOperator
        Parameters:
        parents - an array of two individuals to undergo subtree crossover. Both individuals must be instances of STGPIndividual.
        event - the end event object to be fired after this operator is performed.
        Returns:
        an array containing two STGPIndividuals that are the result of the crossover
        See Also:
        AbstractOrganismOperator.getEndEvent(Organism...)

      • getEndEvent

        protected SubtreeCrossover.EndEvent getEndEvent(Organism... parents)
        Returns a SubtreeCrossoverEndEvent with the operator and parents set
        Overrides:
        getEndEvent in class AbstractOrganismOperator
        Parameters:
        parents - the individuals undergoing the operator.
        Returns:
        the operator's end event.

      • crossoverPoint

        protected int crossoverPoint(TypedOrganism individual)
        Chooses a crossover point at random in the program tree of the given individual. The probability that a terminal is selected is equal to the result of the getTerminalProbability() method. If the terminal probability is -1.0 then all nodes will be selected from at random.
        Parameters:
        individual - the individual to choose a crossover point in
        Returns:
        the index of the crossover point selected in the given individual's program tree.

      • selectNodeIndex

        protected int selectNodeIndex(java.util.List<Node> nodes)
        Selects a node in the list of nodes given and returns the index. The node is selected at random from the list, but the probability that a terminal will be selected is equal to the result of the getTerminalProbability() method. If the terminal probability is set to -1.0 then all nodes are selected from with equal probability.
        Parameters:
        nodes - the list of nodes to select from
        Returns:
        the index of the node that was selected

      • inputSize

        public int inputSize()
        Returns the number of individuals expected by the operator.

        Subtree crossover operates on 2 individuals.

        Specified by:
        inputSize in interface OrganismOperator
        Returns:
        the number of individuals expected by the operator.

      • probability

        public double probability()
        Returns the probability of the operator (the higher the value, the more frequent the operator is used).
        Specified by:
        probability in interface OrganismOperator
        Returns:
        the probability of the operator.

      • setProbability

        public void setProbability(double probability)
        Sets the probability of this operator being selected
        Parameters:
        probability - the new probability to set

      • getRandomSequence

        public RandomSequence getRandomSequence()
        Returns the random number sequence in use
        Returns:
        the currently set random sequence

      • setRandomSequence

        public void setRandomSequence(RandomSequence random)
        Sets the random number sequence to use. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the RandomSequence.RANDOM_SEQUENCE configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        random - the random number generator to set

      • getTerminalProbability

        public double getTerminalProbability()
        Returns the probability that a terminal will be selected as the crossover point
        Returns:
        the probability of a terminal being selected or -1.0 to indicate equal probability for all nodes

      • setTerminalProbability

        public void setTerminalProbability(double terminalProbability)
        Sets the probability that a terminal should be selected as the crossover point. The value should be between 0.0 and 1.0, or 1.0 to indicate that an equal probability should be assigned to all nodes. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the TERMINAL_PROBABILITY configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        terminalProbability - the probability that a terminal should be selected

      • getMaximumDepth

        public int getMaximumDepth()
        Returns the maximum depth for program trees that are returned from this operator
        Returns:
        the maximum depth for program trees

      • setMaximumDepth

        public void setMaximumDepth(int maxDepth)
        Sets the maximum depth for program trees returned from this operator. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the TypedOrganism.MAXIMUM_DEPTH configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        maxDepth - the maximum depth for program trees
